node.title: What Might Have Been...Can Be!
node.description: After the 1901 General Conference Session, Ellen White had a vision in which she saw church leaders reconciling their differences and confessing their sins against each other. When she awoke from the vision, Mrs. White realized that what she had witnessed was not a reality. Pride and hardened hearts prevented God's people from being united. Deeply grieved, she understood that the Lord could have come in their lifetime, but His people did not surrender their thoughts and opinions to the leading of the Holy Spirit.
